newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU GDP rises 0.3 percent in fourth quarter 1996.
newsitem.headline: EU GDP rises 0.3 percent in fourth quarter 1996.

text.p: Economic growth in the European Union advanced by 0.3 percent in the fourth quarter of 1996 compared with the third quarter, Eurostat, the EU's statistical office said on Wednesday.
The latest rise in Gross Domestic Product was somewhat slower than the third quarter's 0.75 percent increase and left total output for 1996 up by 1.6 percent.
"Most member states saw reductions in the rate of growth last year," Eurostat said, with the exceptions being Greece, the Netherlands and Portugal.
The strongest gain in GDP was seen in Ireland while the smallest increase occurred in Italy.
